title: LightFC-X: Lightweight Convolutional Tracker for RGB-X Tracking
author: Yunfeng Li (University of Surrey), Bo Wang (University of Surrey), Ye Li (University of Surrey), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces a lightweight multimodal tracking framework that utilizes convolutional architectures, which could be helpful for developing efficient audio-visual integration systems in audio processing tasks.
background: Lightweight convolutional trackers are employed to efficiently predict object states across multiple modalities (RGB, Thermal, Depth, Event, and Sonar) in real-time conditions.
contribution: LightFC-X introduces novel modules (Efficient Cross-Attention Module and Spatiotemporal Template Aggregation Module) to solve the problem of heavy multimodal tracking frameworks, achieving state-of-the-art performance while significantly reducing the number of parameters and increasing speed.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing RGB-X trackers often rely on heavy transformer architectures resulting in high parameter counts and low inference speed.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by adopting a convolutional-only architecture with efficient cross-modal interactions, substantially decreasing parameters and increasing real-time performance on CPUs.

key_innovation: It uniquely integrates lightweight mechanisms to manage feature interactions across modalities and enhances model adaptability to spatiotemporal changes through fine-tuning.
real_world_impact: The framework's lightweight nature makes it well-suited for resource-constrained environments such as drones, improving tracking capabilities in various applications, including surveillance and environmental monitoring.
limitations: The paper acknowledges that while it achieves significant advancements, the use of spatiotemporal features remains under-explored.
open_sourcing: The code is available at https://github.com/LiYunfengLYF/LightFC-X
